thread.title: Gould gives Bears win at the end
thread.title_full: Gould gives Bears win at the end

author: Aaron Hancock
title: Gould gives Bears win at the end
text:
Gould gives Bears win at the end Posted: aaronhancock@14news.com CHICAGO (WFIE) - 
John Fox's Chicago Bears were staring an 0-4 start right in the face when Jay Cutler and Robbie Gould played heroes for the "Monsters of the Midway". 
Cutler engineered the game-winning drive, starting at the Bears' 20-yard line, and got them to the Oakland 32. That's when Gould came on and drilled the game-winning 49-yard field goal. 
Chicago got off to a 6-0 lead on a TD pass from Cutler to Eddie Royal. From there, Oakland answered back with two touchdowns for a 14-6 lead. Another Cutler TD to Martellus Bennett cut that lead, down to 14-13. 
The two teams then traded two field goals apiece, after that, with the last Sebastian Janikowski field goal, giving the Raiders a 20-19 lead, with two minutes left. That set the stage, for the Bears game-winning drive. 
Cutler finished the game with 281 yards passing, two touchdowns, and one interception.
